content.value: This document provides a complete guide for integrating the Character Selection System (v1.2) into your Unreal Engine projects. It is designed for modularity, using interface-driven communication and decomposed widgets to ensure effortless integration and extension.
Support: For questions or assistance, please leave a comment on the product page or join the Discord server for faster resolution. Please consider rating and reviewing the asset if it proves useful.
Integration Strategy

Modular Design: The system is heavily interface-driven. Widgets are decomposed into reusable elements to unify style and logic across different screens .
GameMode Logic: The BP_GM_CSD GameMode handles the management of on-screen widgets (creation, removal, and updates) .
Player Controller: The PC_CSD manages current character data and fetch logic (Next/Previous).
World Space UI: Except for the main menu screen, all other screens are accessed and operated around the player in world space.
Migration Guide

1. Copy/Migrate the entire CharacterSelectionSystem folder to your project.
2. Create data assets for your characters (DA_PDA_CD_xyz) and add them to the master list DA_PDA_CSD.
3. Switch your GameMode to BP_GM_CharacterSelection (or copy its logic if using a custom GM).
4. Switch your PlayerController to BP_PC_CharacterSelection (or implement the fetch logic/interfaces in your own).
Key Updates

• Widget Architecture: Screens are now built using Container Frames (exposed layout properties) and reusable Widget Elements (prefixed with E_) .
  • Emotes: Characters now play emote animations during the selection process .
  • Circular List: Added support for bidirectional circular character selection (Last ↔ First) .
  • Quality of Life: Fixed camera rotation during gameplay and cursor visibility issues.
Character Data (DA_PDA_CD_xyz)

Create a new Data Asset derived from PDA_CharacterData for each character .
• Name: Appears as an attribute on the right side .
• Description: Flavor text displayed on the lower left .
• Icon: Thumbnail image or game logo.
Selection List (DA_PDA_CSD)
Derived from PDA_CharacterSelectionData. This contains an array of character data assets. The order in this array determines the order in the selection menu.
Interfaces

The system uses BPI_PlayerInterface across multiple classes:
• Widget: Receives messages to disable buttons .
• GameMode: Handles construction/deconstruction of widgets .
• PlayerController: Fetches character data .
• Character: Receives input availability messages.
Character Setup

Ensure your blueprint inherits from the standard Character class and implements BPI_PlayerInterface. Add the BPC_PlayerAttributes component to store dummy data (Price, Strength, Rating) for UI display.
Character Selection Screen

Displays attributes (Name, Strength, Rating) fetched via interfaces. You can toggle CircularList to enable infinite scrolling through the character array. Attributes are editable in the BPC_Attributes component.
Main Menu
A refined sample main menu is included. To change styling (buttons, text), modify the elements in the Widgets > Elements folder.
World Settings

To initialize the system:
1. Set GameMode Override to BP_GM_CharacterSelectionSystem.
2. Set Player Controller Class to BP_PC_CharacterSelectionSystem.
Camera Director

The system uses a component-based camera manager on the character blueprint .
• States: Controls properties for MainMenu, Selection, and Gameplay .
• Rigs: Specific Data Assets defining camera behavior for each state.
